item.text: Now a wife of one of the prophets appealed to Elisha for help, saying, “Your servant, my husband is dead. You know that your servant was a loyal follower of the Lord. Now the creditor is coming to take away my two boys to be his servants.”

<st data-num="0477" class="">Elisha</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> can I <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> for you? <st data-num="05046" class="">Tell</st> me, <st data-num="04100" class="">what</st> do you <st data-num="03426" class="">have</st> in the <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>?” She <st data-num="0559" class="">answered</st>, “Your <st data-num="08198" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="0369" class="">has</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">nothing</st> in the <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st> <st data-num="03588 0518">except</st> a <st data-num="0610" class="">small jar</st> of <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st>.”

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="01980" class="">Go</st> and <st data-num="07592 03627 04480 02351 0854">ask</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> your <st data-num="07934" class="">neighbors</st> for <st data-num="07386" class="">empty</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">containers</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0408 04591">Get as many as</st> you <st data-num="0408 04591">can</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="0935" class="">Go</st> and <st data-num="05462" class="">close</st> the <st data-num="01817" class="">door</st> <st data-num="01157" class="">behind</st> you <st data-num="01157" class="">and</st> your <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>. <st data-num="03332" class="">Pour</st> the olive oil <st data-num="05921" class="">into</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">the</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">containers</st>;<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05265" class="">set aside</st> each one when you have <st data-num="04392" class="">filled</st> it.”

So she <st data-num="01980 0854">left</st> him and <st data-num="05462" class="">closed</st> the <st data-num="01817" class="">door</st> <st data-num="01157" class="">behind</st> her <st data-num="01157" class="">and</st> her <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>. As <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> were <st data-num="05066" class="">bringing</st> the containers <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her, <st data-num="01931" class="">she</st> was <st data-num="03332" class="">pouring</st> the olive oil.

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> the <st data-num="03627" class="">containers</st> <st data-num="04390" class="">were full</st>, she <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> one of her <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="05066 0413">Bring</st> me <st data-num="05750" class="">another</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">container</st>.” But he <st data-num="0559 0413">answered</st> her, “<st data-num="0369" class="">There are no</st> <st data-num="05750 03627">more</st>.” Then the <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">stopped flowing</st>.
She went and told the prophet. He said, “Go, sell the olive oil. Repay your creditor, and then you and your sons can live off the rest of the profit.”
One day Elisha traveled to Shunem, where a prominent woman lived. She insisted that he stop for a meal. So whenever he was passing through, he would stop in there for a meal.

She <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st>, “<st data-num="02009 04994">Look</st>, I’<st data-num="03045" class="">m sure</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="01931" class="">man</st> who <st data-num="08548" class="">regularly</st> <st data-num="05674" class="">passes</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">through here</st> is a <st data-num="06918" class="">very special</st> <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet</st>.<n id="2" />
Let’s make a small, private upper room and furnish it with a bed, table, chair, and lamp. When he visits us, he can stay there.”
One day Elisha came for a visit; he went into the upper room and rested.

He <st data-num="0559 0413">told</st> his <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="01522" class="">Gehazi</st>, “<st data-num="07121" class="">Ask</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">the</st> <st data-num="07767">Shunammite woman</st> <st data-num="07121" class="">to come here</st>.”<n id="1" /> So he <st data-num="07121" class="">did so</st> and she <st data-num="05975" class="">came</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">to</st> him.<n id="2" />

Elisha <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to Gehazi,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="0559 04994 0413">Tell</st> her, ‘<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st>, you have <st data-num="02729 0413">treated</st> us <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">such</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">great</st> <st data-num="02731" class="">respect</st>.<n id="2" /> <st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> can I <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> for you? <st data-num="03426" class="">Can</st> I <st data-num="01696" class="">put in a</st> good <st data-num="01696" class="">word</st> for you <st data-num="0413" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0176 0413">or</st> the <st data-num="08269" class="">commander</st> of the <st data-num="06635" class="">army</st>?’” She <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “<st data-num="0595" class="">I</st>’<st data-num="03427" class="">m</st> <st data-num="08432 05971">quite secure</st>.”<n id="3" />

So he <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st> Gehazi,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> can I <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> for her?” <st data-num="01522" class="">Gehazi</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “She has <st data-num="0369" class="">no</st> <st data-num="061 01121">son</st>, and her <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st> <st data-num="02204" class="">is old</st>.”

Elisha <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> him, “<st data-num="07121" class="">Ask</st> her <st data-num="07121" class="">to come here</st>.”<n id="1" /> So he <st data-num="07121" class="">did so</st><n id="2" /> and she came and <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> in the <st data-num="06607" class="">doorway</st>.<n id="3" />

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “About <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="04150" class="">time</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">next</st> <st data-num="06256" class="">year</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> will be <st data-num="02263" class="">holding</st> a <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.” She <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="0408" class="">No</st>, my <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st>! O <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet</st>, do <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03576" class="">lie</st> to your <st data-num="08198" class="">servant</st>!”
The woman did conceive, and at the specified time the next year she gave birth to a son, just as Elisha had told her.
The boy grew and one day he went out to see his father who was with the harvest workers.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st>, “My <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st>! My <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st>!” His father<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559 0413">told</st> a <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st>, “<st data-num="05375" class="">Carry</st> him <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="0517" class="">mother</st>.”

So he <st data-num="05375" class="">picked</st> him <st data-num="05375" class="">up</st> and <st data-num="0935" class="">took</st> him <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="0517" class="">mother</st>. He <st data-num="03427" class="">sat</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> her <st data-num="01290" class="">lap</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="06672" class="">noon</st> and then <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>.

She <st data-num="05927" class="">went up</st> and <st data-num="07901" class="">laid</st> him <st data-num="07901" class="">down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet’s</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04296" class="">bed</st>. She <st data-num="05462" class="">shut</st> the door <st data-num="01157" class="">behind</st> her and <st data-num="03318" class="">left</st>.

She <st data-num="07121 0559">called</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st>, “<st data-num="07971 04994">Send</st> me <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="05288" class="">servants</st> and <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of the <st data-num="0860" class="">donkeys</st>, so I can <st data-num="07323 05704">go see</st> the <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet</st> <st data-num="07323 05704">quickly</st> and then <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st>.”

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="04069" class="">Why</st> do <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> want to <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">see</st> him <st data-num="03117" class="">today</st>? It is <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> the <st data-num="02320" class="">new moon</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03808" class="">or</st> the <st data-num="07676" class="">Sabbath</st>.” She <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="07965" class="">Everything’s fine</st>.”<n id="2" />
She saddled the donkey and told her servant, “Lead on. Do not stop unless I say so.”
So she went to visit the prophet at Mount Carmel. When he saw her at a distance, he said to his servant Gehazi, “Look, it’s the Shunammite woman.

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st>, <st data-num="07323 04994">run</st> to <st data-num="07125" class="">meet</st> her and <st data-num="0559" class="">ask</st> her, ‘Are you <st data-num="07965" class="">well</st>? Are your <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st> and the <st data-num="03206" class="">boy</st> <st data-num="07965" class="">well</st>?’” She <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> Gehazi,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="07965" class="">Everything’s fine</st>.”

But when she reached the prophet on the mountain, she grabbed hold of his feet. Gehazi came near to push her away, but the prophet said, “Leave her alone, for she is very upset. The Lord has kept the matter hidden from me; he didn’t tell me about it.”

She <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “Did I <st data-num="07592 0854">ask</st> my <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st> <st data-num="07592 0854">for</st> a <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>? <st data-num="03808" class="">Didn’t</st> I <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st>, ‘<st data-num="03808" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="07952" class="">mislead</st> me?’”

Elisha<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> <st data-num="01522" class="">Gehazi</st>, “<st data-num="02296" class="">Tuck</st> your <st data-num="02296" class="">robes</st> into your <st data-num="04975" class="">belt</st>, <st data-num="03947 03027">take</st> my <st data-num="04938" class="">staff</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st>! <st data-num="03808" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="06030" class="">stop to</st> <st data-num="01288" class="">exchange greetings</st> <st data-num="03588 04672 0376">with anyone</st>!<n id="3" /> <st data-num="07760" class="">Place</st> my <st data-num="04938" class="">staff</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="05288" class="">child’s</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">face</st>.”
The mother of the child said, “As certainly as the Lord lives and as you live, I will not leave you.” So Elisha got up and followed her back.
Now Gehazi went on ahead of them. He placed the staff on the child’s face, but there was no sound or response. When he came back to Elisha he told him, “The child did not wake up.”

When <st data-num="0477" class="">Elisha</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st> at the <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>, <st data-num="02009" class="">there was</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="05288" class="">child</st> <st data-num="07901" class="">lying</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">dead</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="04296" class="">bed</st>.
He went in by himself and closed the door. Then he prayed to the Lord.

He <st data-num="05927" class="">got up</st> on the bed and <st data-num="07901" class="">spread</st> his <st data-num="07901" class="">body out</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03206" class="">boy</st>; he <st data-num="07760" class="">put</st> his <st data-num="06310" class="">mouth</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the boy’s<n id="2" /> <st data-num="06310" class="">mouth</st>, his <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> the boy’s <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st>, and the <st data-num="03709" class="">palms of</st> his <st data-num="03709" class="">hands</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the boy’s <st data-num="03709" class="">palms</st>. As he <st data-num="01457" class="">bent down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">across</st> him, the <st data-num="03206" class="">boy’s</st> <st data-num="01320" class="">skin</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="02552" class="">grew warm</st>.

Elisha<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07725" class="">went back</st> and <st data-num="01980" class="">walked</st> <st data-num="0259 02008 0259 02008">around</st> in the <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>.<n id="2" /> Then he <st data-num="05927" class="">got up</st> on the bed again<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="01457" class="">bent down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> him. The <st data-num="05288" class="">child</st> <st data-num="02237" class="">sneezed</st> <st data-num="05704 07651">seven</st> <st data-num="06471" class="">times</st> and <st data-num="06491 05288">opened</st> his <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st>.

Elisha<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07121" class="">called</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01522" class="">Gehazi</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="07121 0413">Get</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">the</st> <st data-num="07767">Shunammite woman</st>.” So he <st data-num="07121" class="">did so</st><n id="2" /> and she <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him. He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to her, “<st data-num="05375" class="">Take</st> your <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.”
She came in, fell at his feet, and bowed down. Then she picked up her son and left.

Now Elisha went back to Gilgal, while there was a famine in the land. Some of the prophets were visiting him and he told his servant, “Put the big pot on the fire and boil some stew for the prophets.”

<st data-num="0259" class="">Someone</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">went out</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st> to <st data-num="03950" class="">gather</st> some <st data-num="0219" class="">herbs</st> and <st data-num="04672" class="">found</st> a <st data-num="07704" class="">wild</st> <st data-num="01612" class="">vine</st>.<n id="1" /> He <st data-num="03950" class="">picked</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">some</st> of its <st data-num="06498 07704">fruit</st>,<n id="2" /> enough to <st data-num="04393" class="">fill up</st> the fold of his <st data-num="0899" class="">robe</st>. He <st data-num="0935" class="">came back</st>, <st data-num="06398" class="">cut</st> it <st data-num="06398" class="">up</st>, and threw the slices<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="05138" class="">stew</st> <st data-num="05518" class="">pot</st>, <st data-num="03588 03808">not</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">knowing</st> they were harmful.<n id="4" />

The stew was <st data-num="03332" class="">poured out</st><n id="1" /> for the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> to <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st>. <st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> they <st data-num="0398" class="">ate</st> some of the <st data-num="05138" class="">stew</st>, <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> <st data-num="06817 0559">cried out</st>, “<st data-num="04194" class="">Death</st> is in the <st data-num="05518" class="">pot</st>, O <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet</st>!” They <st data-num="03201" class="">could</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it.
He said, “Get some flour.” Then he threw it into the pot and said, “Now pour some out for the men so they may eat.” There was no longer anything harmful in the pot.

Now a man from Baal Shalisha brought some food for the prophet—20 loaves of bread made from the firstfruits of the barley harvest, as well as fresh ears of grain. Elisha said, “Set it before the people so they may eat.”
But his attendant said, “How can I feed a hundred men with this?” He replied, “Set it before the people so they may eat, for this is what the Lord has said, ‘They will eat and have some left over.’”
So he set it before them; they ate and had some left over, just as in the Lord’s message.
